This  is one case where throwing lots of money  at it will not solve it but actually makes it worse. To resolve it  it will br necessary to  introduce actotal reorganization of the way money is controlled in the economy. Let's examine the difference between to different economies. In economy A the government  as a regular function buys bonds on a weekly basis from large banks at .25% interests. And this is the reality. These very large banks then Hobson to lend they money to the intermediate market at 2 to 5%. This amounts to an 800 to a1,000% gross Modtly at 5% =1000% gross. That's because of the credit ratings if the borrower. Thus rating factor is not assessed by a neutral organization. But one that relies on income from the banks as its sustenance.  By the funds reach the commercial borrower  its costing them 15%. So the cost of his goods have to be marked up by that 15% before the cost if overheads and other operating cost on which that margin has ti be added before a dime if profit is realized. In economy B the government similarly gone a weekly basis gies to the market and purchase equal amounts of bonds charging twice the rate at .5% . This us paid to the larger banks who onlend it go the middle order banks at 1% rate which amount to 100% gross. The middle banks on lend to retail banking at 1.5%.  By the funds gets to the commercial borrower they get it at a rate of 3 to 5%. This is the cost of funds mark up on their price as the cost of funds required to  do  business.Compare these two different economic systems and tell  which is the better system and which creates a weakthiet more equal society. These are real countries. They are not hypothetical. They exist today.
